summary: The Cross-Boundary Wildfire Solutions Act directs the Comptroller General of the United States to study existing programs, rules, and authorities related to wildfire mitigation across land ownership boundaries (Federal and non-Federal). The study will examine which factors enable or inhibit mitigation efforts, and assess whether changes could improve the capacity and access to funding for relevant agencies and governments. The Comptroller General will submit a report with findings and recommendations to Congress within two years of the Act's enactment.
